spec.name: Comptoir des mines Building
spec.description: The Comptoir des Mines Building, also known as the **Taher Sebti Building**, is a monumental structure completed in 1930. It originally housed the **Comptoir des Mines**, a major colonial-era financial institution focused on mining and industry. The building's architecture is reflective of the grand, commercial Art Deco style prevalent in the city's financial district. It currently functions as a bank. Its historical and architectural importance was recognized with its designation as a **National Material Patrimony** site in 2018.

timeline.title: Building Completed
timeline.description: The Comptoir des Mines building was completed.

timeline.title: National Material Patrimony Declaration
timeline.description: The building was officially included in the National Material Patrimony of Morocco.

access.comment: Functions as a bank office; interior access is limited to bank clients and staff.
